page.title: 04Village Amenities - (1)
page.content: As in many comparable villages {facilities available have declined}in Petham since 1945. The baker,cobbler, blacksmith, post office, garage and shops have all gone - the last shop closed 6 years ago. The only form of {retailing}is provided by the public house and 2 roadside outlets for fruit and vegetables. The{bus timetable}has been cut back but supplemented by a {post bus}which takes the mail and passengers. There is a doorstep{milk and{newspaper delivery}and a grocery van visits each week. A mobile{library visits and a{doctor's surgery}is held weekly in the Parish Hall. Most of the Parish has mains water, electricity, telephone and drainage but no gas supply. The village school provides primary{education}and there is a non-conformist{chapel and the Church of 'All Saints'.
